page.title: 02SIX FARMS NEAR LIMAVADY I
page.content: SOME FACTS ABOUT THE FARMS WE SURVEYED 1 Farm sizes ranged from{64 to 600 {acres}(Average = 290 acres). This is much larger than normal in N Ireland. 2 80% of the farmers' incomes is from {crops,}and 20% is from sheep and beef cattle; this is also very unusual for N Ireland. 3 The farms are highly mechanised - the machinery on one farm cost Â£120,000. As a result one man can farm up to 300 acres, and most of the farms are worked by the farmer alone. Extra workers are only employed at harvest time. 4 {Land use}is as follows: Barley 26% Wheat 24% Peas 4% Oil Seed Rape 18% Potatoes 16% Flax 1% Oats 1% Grass for grazing and silage 10%
